title: (Thunderbird) View message in new window instead of new tab?
creator: nic18
content:
Hi,

Knowing this is the "ask the community" 's Thread, but don't know where else has official place to share about Thunderbird's info.

For those who wonder how to change this settings (View message in new window), I had searched up and down the net there is no new updated method has been shared.

It is easy and here is settings to change: Click at upper right corner resembles "Hamburger" icon > Settings > General > Scroll down till "Open messages in:" > Select "A new message window".

Done. You're welcome :)

title: Thunderbird Inbox overrides actual sender name with wrong sender name from its data base
creator: MandyWh
content:
Thunderbird inbox shows wrong sender name for message, overriding what the person actually sent with something from its data base. Attached screen shots illustrate:

-- Message is sent from [email]@earthlink.net. This was a joint account for a married couple. When they sent messages, each would have their Email client show the name of the sender. The husband died several years ago, and now the wife is the only one using the account.

-- Screen Shot #1: When I access the message via Thunderbird, for some reason it overrides the name provided by the sender with something from its data base (in this case, the name of the dead husband).

-- Screen Shot #2: When I access the message directly from Gmail, it shows the correct sender name.

This seems to me to be a bug. But if it's not, is there some parameter I can set so that Thunderbird doesn't "help" me with overrides like this?

Thanks for any help anybody can offer.

title: mail inviate da thunderbird finiscono nello spam del destinatario
creator: andrea104
content:
Buongiorno, thunderbird ha sempre funzionato correttamente, in questi giorni qualsiasi mail che inoltro, rispondo o creo, la posta finisce nello spam del destinatario (anche se ho aggiornato il programma alla versione 136).

Non capendo se era un problema del dominio, magari inserito nella blacklist, ho verificato online su multirbl e mi da tutto verde, anche perché non invio nessuna massmail.

Poi la prova successiva è stata mandare la mail da "webmail" e li vanno a finire nella posta in arrivo del destinatario.

Secondo step, ho riconfigurato l'account su un altro client di posta e qui funziona (come webmail).

Come ho fatto le prove? Tramite le mie mail (diverse per dominio) e le mail dei colleghi (anche qui diverse per dominio).

Una volta visto questo che le mail arrivano da altri programmi, non so cosa posso fare su thunderbird, ho sempre usato thunderbird e ho tutta la posta li e non vorrei assolutamente cambiare client.

Magari se è capitato a qualcuno e può dirmi come ha risolto oppure qualche suggerimento anche modificando qualche variabile su thunderbird (Editor di configurazione...).

Grazie per ogni aiuto che possiate darmi!

Andrea
metadata: ;useragent:Mozilla/5.0 (Macintosh; Intel Mac OS X 10.15; rv:136.0) Gecko/20100101 Firefox/136.0;solver_id:6549836

title: Thunderbird passwords not accepted today
creator: rbb4
content:
I'm having terrible problems with Thunderbird on my PC today and wonder if anyone can help ???

I looked at some spam killer software yesterday and installed Mailwasher and later Annihilator to test them. Being unsatisfied, I uninstalled both.

But when I logged onto Thunderbird this morning, the basic accounts appeared but no past emails anywhere. So I tried to receive new email and send email and all my server settings are correct but Thunderbird will NOT accept any of my historic passwords. Tried everything many, many times but it keeps rejecting my normal historic passwords there.

I can send email from my Thunderbird PC but not receive emails or see my history there. My Local Folders work properly.

Wonder if Mailwasher or Spamihilator changed my Thunderbird passwords, even though I uninstalled both. No idea what they might be.

My Android email still works perfectly.

Can you help -- help -- or have any ideas ???

title: S/MIME certificate import
creator: tomasgrycz
content:
Dear Thunderbird Support Team,

I'm experiencing an issue with using my digital signing certificate in Thunderbird. I have imported a p12 certificate into Thunderbird on my Ubuntu system, and everything seemed to go fine during the import. However, when I try to digitally sign my emails, I receive an error message that says, "Certificate Manager can't locate a valid certificate that can be used to digitally sign your messages with an address of [XXX@XYZ]." It is hosted by an academic institution using office365 products.

I have checked the certificate details and noticed that the Basic Constraints section shows "Certificate Authority: No" marked as critical. I’ve seen that certificates on the internet often have different settings, and I’m wondering if this might be causing Thunderbird to not be able to find my certificate. I have checked the authority settings and both boxes are marked.

I am running the latest version of Thunderbird on Ubuntu, and I have verified that the certificate is imported under "Your Certificates" in Thunderbird's Certificate Manager. My email address in Thunderbird matches the one on the certificate, but the error persists. I would appreciate any help.

Best regards, Thomas G.
metadata: ;useragent:Mozilla/5.0 (X11; Ubuntu; Linux x86_64; rv:136.0) Gecko/20100101 Firefox/136.0

title: Mangled Content-Transfer-Encoding 8bit
creator: tamo_bln
content:
Hello,

Today I added a new mail account and used it to write a test mail containing German umlauts. The result is this:

Subject: Das ist ein Testmail Content-Type: text/plain; charset=UTF-8; format=flowed Content-Transfer-Encoding: 8bit

Hi,

ich sende dir eine Testmail!

Liebe GrÃ¼ÃŸe

In other accounts that are also configured in Thunderbird but run on other servers, the result looks different. Namely:

Content-Type: text/plain; charset=UTF-8; format=flowed Content-Transfer-Encoding: quoted-printable

Das ist ein Test.

Alles Liebe! =C3=A4=C3=B6=C3=BC =C3=84=C3=96=C3=9C=C3=9F=C3=9F=C3=9F

The latter is correct and right. Why does Thunderbird behave differently for the newly created account?

Kind regards

tamo_bln
